The visual evidence strongly supports the identification of the dog as a Beagle.

The dog's head is relatively small compared to its body, typical for many hound breeds.

The dog in the image has large, floppy ears that hang down on either side of its head. These ears appear to be a light brown color with darker brown spots or patches, giving them a speckled appearance. The texture seems soft and slightly wrinkled, typical of certain hound breeds. The ears are relatively large compared to the dog's head, adding to their prominence. There are no unique markings or tags visible on the ears, and they do not have any distinctive features such as tufts of fur at the tips. The ears' size and shape suggest they are well-suited for their breed, likely aiding in hearing and cooling.
